items.title: No, not even water: A guide to Ramadan for non-Muslims
items.summary: Wonder what Ramadan is all about? Here's why many Muslims fast during the holy month, and how to best support your practising friends.

items.title: Sabina quit snacking after monitoring her sugar levels. Is the data that simple?

items.summary: Jesse Jackson cast himself as a barrier-breaker for people of colour, the impoverished and the powerless.

items.summary: An open letter signed by film industry figures condemned the Berlin Film Festival's "neutral stance" on Gaza.

items.title: Do migrants feel they belong in Australia? The answer is complicated
items.summary: Interviews with migrants from Australia's fastest growing communities show only 32 per cent feel a great sense of belonging.

items.summary: The Opposition has unveiled its shadow ministry, with a mix of new and old faces taking up frontbench positions.

items.summary: Iran's foreign minister said there was still much work to be done after talks with the US in Geneva ended.

items.summary: As many Asians living in Australia return to their ancestral homes for Lunar New Year, what awaits them can be surprising.

items.summary: Living funerals are an emerging practice in Australia, allowing people to say goodbye to loved ones before they die.

items.summary: The restrictions were rushed through NSW parliament after the Bondi terror attack in December.

items.title: Landmark study finds 'systemic' racism in Australian universities

items.summary: A file of complaints reveals that cash, phones, and food are being used to extort NDIS funding from vulnerable First Nations people in remote Northern Territory.

items.summary: The fire horse, which occurs once every 60 years, is considered to be like "double fire".

items.summary: Supporters say trophy hunting is misunderstood. But critics call it cruelty dressed up as conservation.

items.summary: The decision is an uncommon legal step amid mounting criticism over accountability for violence in the occupied territories.

items.summary: The Oscar-winning American actor died peacefully at his home after a career spanning more than six decades.

items.summary: The consumer watchdog's barrister said increased costs are irrelevant to whether products are promoted to customers as genuine discounts.

items.summary: The women and children had been released from Roj camp in Syria for repatriation to Australia but were then forced to turn back.
